T1.label: LNG Growth Champion
T1.description: Woodside Energy Group executes on growth strategy; earnings accelerate
T1.plain_english: Scarborough delivers on time in Q4 2026, making Woodside a top-5 global LNG producer. LNG demand growth (Asia, emerging markets) sustains prices. Free cash flow surges post-Scarborough capex, enabling higher distributions and portfolio expansion. Louisiana LNG and Trion extend the growth runway.
T1.what_to_watch: Next earnings result and forward guidance.
T1.upside: Material re-rating if execution surprises to the upside.
T1.risk_plain: If growth disappoints, this narrative weakens.

T2.label: Execution Risk Materialises
T2.description: Woodside Energy Group delivers steady-state results; valuation holds
T2.plain_english: CEO departure during Scarborough's critical final phase creates execution risk. Scarborough delays, cost overruns, or Pluto turnaround complications impair near-term earnings. Louisiana LNG capex adds balance sheet pressure without near-term returns.
T2.risk_plain: If the base case is already priced in, limited upside from here.

T3.label: Energy Transition Stranded Asset Risk
T3.description: Woodside Energy Group faces headwinds; earnings or multiples compress
T3.plain_english: Climate litigation, ESG de-rating, and peak LNG demand risk create a permanent valuation discount. The 58% shareholder vote against the climate plan signals institutional dissatisfaction. Long-life hydrocarbon assets face stranded asset risk as the energy transition accelerates.
T3.what_to_watch: Cost pressures, competitive threats, or macro headwinds.
T3.risk_plain: Material downside if multiple risks crystallise simultaneously.

T4.label: Value Trap with Yield Support
T4.description: A structural shift changes the investment case for Woodside Energy Group
T4.plain_english: Woodside trades range-bound between A$18-27 indefinitely. The ~6.9% yield attracts income investors but the stock never re-rates higher. Energy transition discount, commodity price volatility, and capital-intensive growth pipeline prevent sustained P/E expansion. Total returns are dividend-driven, not capital-appreciation-driven.
T4.what_to_watch: Industry disruption signals and regulatory changes.
T4.risk_plain: If disruption materialises, prior assumptions become invalid.

big_picture: Woodside is at a strategic inflection point. Scarborough LNG (94% complete) will make Woodside a top-5 global LNG producer upon delivery in Q4 2026. 1H 2025 delivered US$6,590M revenue (+10%), US$3,339M operating cash flow, and 82% cash margins. But the CEO departed to become BP CEO, 58% of shareholders voted against the climate transition plan, and the energy transition creates a structural overhang on long-life hydrocarbon assets. At 11.7x trailing P/E with ~6.9% yield, the market is paying for income, not growth.
